description: Bleeding Milk Cap has an orange to orange-brown cap (5-15 cm) with darker concentric zones. Gills are pale orange, crowded, decurrent. Stem is orange with scrobiculations. KEY FEATURE: DARK RED to WINE-RED LATEX (milk) that exudes when cut - distinctive blood-red color. Latex slowly stains tissues reddish-purple. Flesh is pale. Spore print is pale cream to pinkish.
habitat: Mycorrhizal with CONIFERS, especially fir, spruce, and hemlock in western North America. Grows on ground in coniferous forests, mountain forests. Prefers well-drained soil.
season: Fall (September-November), fruiting after rains in mountains.
lookalikes: Lactarius deliciosus - orange latex not red
Lactarius sanguifluus - similar red latex, different host
Other orange Lactarius - check latex color
safety_notes: CHOICE EDIBLE: Highly prized for its mild flavor. The distinctive DARK RED LATEX is diagnostic. Stains purple when cooked - this is normal. Best when young and firm. Cook thoroughly.
